subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Other---creatures? [1 Attachment]
author: Tim Woolworth
full_text:
I hear US SPIDERS DO very clearly.

Talking to bugs is not that weird, I am guilty of it too.  I have a dislike
of spiders myself, they just creep me out.  Back about ten years ago I was
living in Northern California and I moved into a house that had spiders
everywhere!  I was practicing Wicca at the time (burn me at the stake!) so I
had a sit down talk with them.  I told the spiders that they could have the
kitchen, the hall and the guest bedroom and I would never bother them as
long as they left the rest of the house alone and never bothered me when we
shared a room.  Guess what?  The next day every spider was gone from my
bedroom and the living room and I never had a single problem with them at
that place.  I have a spider on my ceiling now and I talked to him at the
beginning of summer and I told him he had to stay on that side of the room
and he hasn't moved any closer to my side of the room.

You can certainly tell the quality difference of that tuner you're using, it
is very clear.

On Mon, Nov 8, 2010 at 12:55 PM, Frank Sumption
<purplealiengirl@...>wrote:

>
>  [Attachment(s) <#12c2ca09b662fe87_TopText> from Frank Sumption included
> below]
>
>  My work room out in the garage, and spiders come in. I told them, yeah I
> talk to bugs--bite me and I gas everyone of ya! They stay outta sight. So
> this was recorded in the garage last night "Us, (or house) Spiders Speak"
> at 15 seconds. Brain is not mind, anything that lives, thinks, ghost voices
> are thoughts. If man thinks he is so advanced, how many can control eight
> legs and spin a web? How many eyes does a fly need if there is no intellect
> to process the information? Humans vastly underestimate the rest of nature.
> Human ego, unjustifiable.
>
>  These big radios make better boxes because the quality of the radio is
> better. Better front end, not so easlily overloaded by strong nearby
> signals, and better IF filter(the down conversion process), less surious
> signals, clearer sound. Larger audio amplifiers, and less distortion.
>
>  F-S
>
>  
>
